definition: lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Ludwig evidently sees evidence of child abuse.
sentences.chinese: 路德维希显然看到了虐待儿童的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: We could see if they can pick up the trail.
sentences.chinese: 咱们可以看看他们能找到些什么蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: The clues, he says, are there if adults watch for them.
sentences.chinese: 他说，做为成年人就是要去观察这些蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: The policeman went among the villagers in disguise and saw if there were straws in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 警察穿着便衣到村民中查访，看看是否有蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: Co-workers and friends are often the first to see the signs.
sentences.chinese: 同事和朋友们常常会首先发现一些蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: Either the government is being extremely diligent in crossing every 't' and dotting every 'i'.
sentences.chinese: 要么是政府工作极度勤勉，不放过任何蛛丝马迹。

definition: lit. to follow the vine to get to the melon/to track sth following clues
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
to try to find out/to trace/to track down
sth one wishes to conceal/the cat (as in "let the cat out of the bag")
lit. to spin silk from cocoons/fig. to make a painstaking investigation (idiom)
